definition[0]: a part of a tree that grows out from the trunk (=main stem) and that has leaves, fruit, or smaller branches growing from it
example[0]: After the storm, the ground was littered with twigs and branches.
example[1]: The topmost branches were full of birds.
definition[1]: a local business, shop etc that is part of a larger business etc
example[2]: The bank has branches all over the country.
example[4]: She now works in our Denver branch.
example[6]: They’re planning to open a branch in St. Louis next year.
example[7]: Have you met our branch manager, Mr. Carlson?
definition[2]: a part of a government or other organization that deals with one particular part of its work
note[0]: the executive/judicial/legislative branch (=the three main parts of the US government)
example[8]: All branches of government are having to cut costs.
definition[3]: one part of a large subject of study or knowledge
definition[4]: a group of members of a family who all have the same ancestors
example[9]: the wealthy South American branch of the family
definition[5]: a smaller less important part of a river, road, or railway that leads away from the larger more important part of it
example[10]: The rail company may have to close the branch line to Uckfield.
definition[6]: to divide into two or more smaller, narrower, or less important parts
example[11]: When you reach the village green, the street branches into two.
definition[7]: an individual bank, shop, office etc that is part of a large organization
example[12]: The business has 170 branches throughout the UK.
example[13]: To talk to one of our specialist financial advisers, just contact your local branch.
definition[8]: a part of a government or a large organization that deals with one particular type of work
example[14]: The executive and judicial branches of government would be totally separate.
definition[9]: a small local organization that is part of a TRADE UNION
example[15]: He is a former chairman of the Belfast branch of the National Union of Journalists.
example[16]: She joined the strike support committee and started going to branch meetings.
